alert.note: Alert for Bighorn Canyon; Musselshell; Northeastern Yellowstone; Northern Big Horn; Northern Carbon; Northern Rosebud; Northern Stillwater; Pryor, Northern Bighorn Mountains; Southeastern Carbon; Southern Big Horn; Southern Rosebud; Southwestern Yellowstone; Treasure (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued December 14 at 5:58PM MST by NWS Billings
info.description: ...AN AREA OF HEAVY SNOW... At 554 PM MST, an area of heavy snow was located along a line extending from near Hysham to Lodge Grass to 14 miles north of Medicine Wheel to 6 miles east of Elk Basin. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. This area of heavy snow will be near... Lodge Grass around 600 PM MST. Colstrip around 700 PM MST. Other locations impacted by this area of heavy snow include Wyola, Parkman, Tongue River Reservoir, Edgar, Pompeys Pillar, Boyd, Bighorn, Molt, Silesia and Warren. The heavy snow will also affect portions of Interstates 90 and 94. The snow can accumulate at a rate of one inch per hour or more in this area of heavy snow. Be prepared for hazardous driving conditions. Visibilities will be less than an mile in snow and blowing snow. Consider delaying travel if you will be going through this area of heavy snow. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
